qas.question: What did Bell call his cord-free phone?
Who did Bell invent the cord-free phone with?
What did Bell's cord-free phone use to transmit messages?
What lab association did Bell and Tainter both eventually join?
In the photophone, light carried sound and what?

context: Bell and his assistant <a1_0>Charles Sumner Tainter<a1_0/> jointly invented a wireless telephone, named a <a0_0>photophone<a0_0/>, which allowed for the transmission of both sounds and <a4_0>normal human conversations<a4_0/> on a beam of <a2_0>light<a2_0/>. Both men later became full associates in the <a3_0>Volta Laboratory Association<a3_0/>.
